text.tspan: Still for extended introspection/sits in nature
Engage and expand natural survival senses
Touch nature to foster object-subject view
Know your area: map, wander, etc.
Cultivate awe, wonder, gratitude for nature
Do art, poetry, story, music, play, etc.
Experiment and improvise for self sufficiency
cultural fabric for ecological learning, e.g.
ecological research, with a secondary aim to
Endorse selfless actions which, in showing
appreciation of ecology, and the web of life,
in developing a sense of identity in order to
play their role or function in their “niche”;
human and natural histories and blend arts
For issues of social and ecological impor
tance, center public dialog on a Leopoldian
land ethic (nature in part of the community)
decision making to be locally informed and
monitored with in partnership with a central
Work towards a system of consensus deci
through dialog that has satisfactorily ensured
Reinstate ecosystem resilience (as a basis for
Employ social marketing tools and tech
niques to shape prevailing social norms and
